title: Ahalya
summary: In Hinduism, Ahalya (Sanskrit: अहल्या, IAST: Ahalyā) also known as  Ahilya, is the wife of the sage Gautama Maharishi. Many Hindu scriptures say that she was seduced by Indra (the king of gods), cursed by her husband for infidelity, and liberated from the curse by Rama (7th avatar of the god Vishnu).
